page.title: 15The Dairy Industry.
page.content: About{Ten Years Ago}the milk went straight from the{cooler}to the{churn. The{churns}were taken to the{milk {department}either by the{farmer's}own transport or by lorries sent by the{ {Milk Processing Company}which called every morning to take away the full{ {churns}and bring back the empty ones. Modern milking parlours with milking machines, pumps, refrigerated storage tanks allow one person to milk{100 {cows}at once. Some farms have{ {computerized equipment}to help care for the animals. However much work machines save, people will still have to operate them. Many{dairy products are made into foods and{dairy produce. Some of cows' milk is turned into butter, cheese and{yogurt.}None of the cow is wasted. The bones are used for{fertilizer, petfoods}and{glue.} { }
